question:
Which among the following recommendation of the Dundas's Bill are correct?
1. Increasing the control of Bengal Presidency over Bombay and Madras
2. Governor-General may work under his own discretion
3. Empowering the Governor-General to hold the office of Commander-in-Chief
4. Restoration of the territory of Zamindars who were affected by the quinquennial settlements
Choose the correct option from the codes given below :
explanation: Dundas\'s Bill was introduced in 1783. The recommendations made by the bill are Increasing the control of Bengal Presidency over Bombay and Madras, Governor-General may work under his own discretion (Governor-General is not bound to accept the opinion of the governor-general council in all matters), Empowering the Governor-General to hold the office of Commander-in-Chief, Restoration of the territory of Zamindars who were affected by the quinquennial settlements. Eventually, the bill was abolished.
